title: From A-plus Wings to C-minus Valkyries, grading every team's WNBA draft performance
content: Dallas, with Paige Bueckers at No. 1, and Washington, which got Sonia Citron at No. 3, got high marks in the WNBA draft.

title: 'It was Paige and Paige only': Wings land Bueckers
content: Paige Bueckers, coming off leading UConn to its first national championship in nine years, was selected No. 1 by the Dallas Wings in the 2025 WNBA draft Monday night.

title: Ward one of 17 to attend NFL draft; no Sanders
content: Miami quarterback Cam Ward, the projected No. 1 pick in the 2025 NFL draft, is one of 17 players confirmed to attend the event in Green Bay, Wisconsin.

title: Former NFL TE Hasselbeck, father of QBs, dies
content: Former NFL tight end Don Hasselbeck, who won a Super Bowl in his nine-year career and was the father of two NFL quarterbacks, died Monday. He was 70.

title: VP Vance fumbles Buckeyes' championship trophy
content: Vice President JD Vance ended the Ohio State football team's visit to the White House on Monday by fumbling the team's national championship trophy.

title: Source: Sharks' Couture unable to continue career
content: The San Jose Sharks scheduled a Tuesday news conference, where the club and captain Logan Couture will announce the veteran center can't continue his playing career because of injury, a source told ESPN's Emily Kaplan on Monday, confirming a report.

title: Skenes, Davis form 1st battery of MLB No. 1 picks
content: In the Pirates' 10-3 win over the Nationals on Monday night, Pittsburgh starter Paul Skenes teamed up with catcher Henry Davis to become the first pitcher/catcher battery in major league history comprised of players selected No. 1 in the draft.

title: Sources: Cal RB Ott, '23 All-Pac-12, enters portal
content: Cal running back Jaydn Ott, a first-team All-Pac-12 selection in 2023, entered the transfer portal on Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Smith 'running it back' for senior year at Purdue
content: Purdue guard Braden Smith, a consensus first-team All-American who averaged 15.8 points and 8.7 assists, which was second in Division I, will return for his senior season.

title: From Paige Bueckers to Hailey Van Lith: Best dressed stars from the 2025 WNBA draft
content: Paige Bueckers and Kiki Iriafen took the orange carpet by storm at the 2025 WNBA draft in New York City. Here are the best fits from the night.

title: Szczesny: Will accept No. 2 role if Flick wishes
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny said on Monday he will accept being dropped for Marc-André ter Stegen if that is what coach Hansi Flick decides.

title: 'Madrid is Madrid': Marcelo warns Arsenal
content: Real Madrid legend Marcelo has said the club cannot be written off as they look to overturn a 3-0 deficit against Arsenal in the Champions League on Wednesday.

title: Slow CWC ticket sales don't worry FIFA's Infantino
content: ATLANTA -- FIFA President Gianni Infantino said he is not concerned about ticket sales for this summer's Club World Cup in the United States despite questions about how well the 32-team event is selling across the country.

title: Heartbreak for Brady as Birmingham lose in final
content: Birmingham City were dealt a shock 2-0 defeat by Peterborough United in the Vertu Trophy final at Wembley Stadium on Sunday, with NFL legend and minority owner of the club Tom Brady watching on.

title: Villa say Rashford, Watkins partnership 'next step'
content: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery suggested he is not ready to unleash Marcus Rashford and Ollie Watkins as a strike partnership against Paris Saint-Germain in the <a...

title: McTominay guides Napoli to big win in Serie A race
content: Napoli cruised to a 3-0 win over relegation-threatened Empoli on Monday with Scott McTominay and Romelu Lukaku leading the charge as the hosts kept pace with Serie A leaders Inter Milan.

title: Garang Kuol eyes summer exit from Newcastle
content: Socceroos winger Garang Kuol has told ESPN that he needs to move away from Newcastle United in the next transfer window to secure first-team football.

title: Van Dijk expects 'a big summer' at Liverpool
content: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has hinted it will be a "big summer" for the club as they look to build on a successful debut season under Arne Slot.

title: Iñigo Martínez gives new meaning to 'remontada' for Barcelona
content: It once looked like the ship to Barcelona had sailed for Iñigo Martínez. Now he's Barça's defensive leader, vital to their hopes of winning the treble.

title: Real Madrid's greatest Champions League comebacks
content: Arsenal beat Madrid 3-0 in the quarterfinal first leg, but history shows Los Blancos can never be counted out.

title: MLS: New No. 1 Vancouver proves it's for real
content: While Miami sputtered vs. Chicago, Vancouver jumped to No. 1 in our MLS Power Rankings by demolishing Austin.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal join Chelsea in race for Barcelona's Koundé
content: Arsenal are ready to fight Chelsea to sign Jules Koundé from Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: Did Lewis Hamilton have a breakthrough with Ferrari in Bahrain?
content: Lewis Hamilton has struggled to adapt to his new home at Ferrari, but he might have turned a corner in Bahrain.

title: CPI(M) demands judicial inquiry by sitting high court judge into Murshidabad violence
content: The CPI(M) leader also said that he filed a petition on Tuesday (April 15, 2025) before the Supreme Court challenging the constitutionality of the Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: Vision is to make 200 million sq ft Grade-A commercial space available in Hyderabad by 2030: Telangana IT Minister
content: U.S. firm Citizens Financial Group’s global capability centre (GCC) inaugurated in Hyderabad. It is expected to scale up to 1,000 IT and Data and Analytics professionals by March 2026

title: ED attaches 707 acres of land worth ₹1,460 crore in Sahara India case
content: The land was allegedly bought in the name of ‘benami’ entities using funds diverted from Sahara Group entities, the agency has alleged

title: India’s first-ever seed germination database coming up
content: This initiative of the Ecological Restoration Alliance-India, offering more than 1,000 germination techniques, intends to help restoration practitioners, nursery managers, and native plant enthusiasts be more successful with their greening endeavours

title: Farmers stage protest and oppose issuing notices to cultivators in Shivamogga
content: Protestors took objections to notices served by officers of the Revenue Department and Forest Department to the farmers.

title: Assamese to be official language for all Govt. communications in Assam
content: However, the order also mentioned exceptions where English would be used, including communication with the Central government and other State governments.

title: SC junks PIL for gender-neutral dowry harassment, maintenance sections; says it's up to Parliament
content: The plea said that in India domestic violence cases can be filed only by women, while in foreign countries even husbands can file such cases and seek maintenance

title: India to see above-normal cumulative rainfall this monsoon, El Nino conditions unlikely: IMD
content: However, normal cumulative rainfall does not guarantee uniform temporal and spatial distribution of rain across the country, with climate change further increasing the variability of the rain-bearing system

title: Tamil Nadu Governor accords sanction to prosecute AIADMK ex-Minister Rajenthra Bhalaji, State informs Supreme Court
content: The State had earlier complained to the Supreme Court about its inability to file chargesheets to prosecute Mr. Bhalaji as its requests for sanctions stood pending with the Governor.

title: Kerala Film Critics Award: ‘Feminichi Fathima’ Best Film, Tovino Thomas, Nazriya Nazim and Rima Kallingal win acting honours
content: Actor-scriptwriter Jagadeesh was awarded with the Ruby Jubilee Award for his outstanding contributions to Malayalam cinema

content: India’s exports and imports data form 2024-25 fiscal year shows slight increase in exports and significant rise in imports

content: Police clarify that the video that is doing the rounds and had become viral was of a two year old incident and the police had already arrested the perpetrators

title: Amaravati international airport proposal gains momentum; A.P. Government explores 30,000 acres land pooling option
content: Andhra Pradesh Government considers Amaravati international airport development, weighing land acquisition options for infrastructure expansion

title: Anti-Waqf law protests: Pleas in Supreme Court seek court-monitored probe into West Bengal violence
content: Supreme Court petitions seek probe into West Bengal violence over Waqf Act, including SIT and judicial enquiry commission requests

title: Vande Bharat sleeper express cabins, now being made in Sri City
content: The company has been supplying lightweight, durable and fire-resistant FRP products to the rail, marine, wind energy and infrastructure sectors, BFG India vice president K. Premamoorthy said

title: AIADMK MLAs walk out of T.N. Assembly
content: The Speaker denied the opportunity to raise issues relating to DMK Ministers, citing that the Chief Minister would make a suo motu statement under Rule 110 of the Assembly during the Zero Hour, said AIADMK leader R.B. Udhayakumar

title: Ilaiyaraaja sends legal notice to makers of Ajith Kumar’s ‘Good Bad Ugly’ over ‘unauthorised’ use of songs
content: ‘Good Bad Ugly’ features three of Ilaiyaraaja’s compositions: ‘Ilamai Idho Idho’ from 1982’s ‘Sakalakala Vallavan,’ ‘En Jodi Manja Kuruvi’ from 1986’s ‘Vikram,’ and ‘Oththa Roova’ from 1996’s ‘Nattupura Pattu’

title: SC extends protection from arrest to former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar in cheating case
content: The Bench took note of the submissions and listed the matter for hearing on April 21 and asked the apex court registry to verify whether Ms. Khedkar’s rejoinder is filed

title: New York City declares April 14 as Dr B.R. Ambedkar Day
content: The official from the New York mayor’s office said Ambedkar’s ideals go beyond borders and time, finding strong connections in the halls of the United Nations and New York—a city built by immigrants

title: ‘What is happening in this High Court?’ Supreme Court frowns upon repeated remarks from Allahabad HC hurtful to women victims of sexual offences
content: While one judge of the High Court ruled that groping a minor and breaking her pyjama string did not add up to attempted rape, another judge granted bail to a rape accused stating that ‘victim herself invited trouble’

title: Wholesale inflation eases to 2.05% in March on cheaper food items
content: Food inflation eased to 1.57% in March, from 3.38% in February, with vegetables seeing sharp drop. Deflation in vegetables was 15.88% during the month, compared to 5.80% in February

title: Saudi Haj Ministry has agreed to reopen portal: Centre amid concerns of ‘cuts on India’s private quota
content: The minority affairs ministry’s statement comes after several Opposition leaders had voiced concern after the reported cancellation of over 52,000 Haj slots by Saudi Arabia for Indian pilgrims

title: Punjab Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa moves HC, seeks quashing of FIR registered against him
content: Senior Congress leader Pratap Singh Bajwa seeks quashing of FIR over “50 bombs in Punjab” statement, faces charges

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces formation of high-level committee to strengthen State’s autonomy
content: The committee is expected to submit its interim report by January 2026 and the final report within two years.

title: Agitation to continue till wages raised, Kerala govt withdrew from talks: protesting ASHA workers
content: S. Mini, State vice president of the Kerala ASHA Health Workers Association said that they were willing to end the agitation if the govt were to increase their honorarium by ₹3,000 and provide ₹5 lakh retirement benefits

title: Physicist-philosopher Ranjit Nair passes away at 70
content: He played a key role in getting world-renowned scientists, including Stephen Hawking, to lecture in India

title: Class 8 student attacks classmate with machete in Tamil Nadu’s Palayamkottai, surrenders
content: Police said the two students, who had developed enmity two months ago over borrowing pencil, had frequent altercations on the school premises

title: Actor-director S.S. Stanley, known for helming ‘April Maadhathil,’ passes away
content: Stanley is best known for his association with actor Srikanth, having helmed ‘April Maadhathil,’ ‘Mercury Pookkal,’ and ‘Kizhakku Kadalkarai Salai’

title: Tejashwi Yadav meets Congress leadership in Delhi ahead of Mahagatbandhan meet in Patna
content: When asked about Mahagatbandhan’s Bihar CM face, Mr. Yadav told reporters, ‘don’t be in a hurry to speculate.’ He further indicated that this was just a preliminary conversation

title: Gujarat man who sent death threat to Salman Khan turns out to be mentally ill
content: Mumbai police issue notice to mentally unstable man threatening Salman Khan, tightens security at his residence

title: India Justice Report 2025: Not a single State/UT meets their own reserved quotas for women in police force
content: IJR 2025 also said that about 17% of police stations in the country do not have a single CCTV, while 3 in 10 police stations do not have women help desks.

title: Truckers’ strike in Karnataka halts lorry movement through Erode’s Dhimbam Ghat Road
content: The strike, announced demanding rollback of the recent diesel price hike and reduction in toll charges, brought the movement of goods to a standstill.

title: Telangana on path to make one crore women ‘crorepatis’: Deputy CM Vikramarka
content: We pray to women as goddesses but also try to control, monitor and dictate them: Deputy CM points at contradiction

title: The necessity for, and the challenges that lie in caring for India’s elderly population
content: While the availability of geriatric care is steadily improving, health is not the only concern: elderly citizens as elderly face numerous social and economic challenges too, say experts

title: 3 killed, 19 injured as truck hits bus in Maharashtra's Buldhana
content: The Madhya Pradesh Transport bus was going from Amravati in Maharashtra to Burhanpur in MP when a truck hit it at Amsari fata

title: Kerala Forest Minister orders probe into death of two tribals in suspected wild elephant attack in Athirappilly
content: Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan blames the deaths on Forest department’s ‘lack of zeal’ in forecasting and mitigating human-wildlife conflict situations

title: ED raids premises of Rajasthan Congress leader Pratap Singh Khachariyawas, others
content: About 15 premises, including the politician’s house in Jaipur, are being searched by the federal probe agency. A security team of the CRPF has also been deployed.

title: K.K. Ragesh appointed new CPI(M) Kannur district secretary
content: The change was necessitated after CPI(M) leader M.V. Jayarajan was included in the party’s State secretariat

title: Telangana Congress rejects PM Modi’s comments on Kancha Gachibowli lands, questions BJP’s ‘poor’ environmental track record
content: The Congress claimed that the BJP government has bulldozed forests in the name of development. Over 3 lakh hectares of forests cleared since 2014, and 99% of forest clearance applications approved without rejections

title: Question of accommodating TTV, OPS will be jointly addressed by BJP, AIADMK: Nainar Nagenthran
content: On the remark made by him—when he took over as the BJP Tamil Nadu unit chief on April 12—that he could only be a breeze while K. Annamalai worked like a storm

title: Karnataka CM to initiate development projects worth ₹492 crore in Kalaburagi on April 16
content: Mr. Siddaramaiah, along with AICC President Mallikarjun Kharge and Deputy CM D. K. Shivakumar, will attend the divisional-level job fair organised at KCT Engineering College in Kalaburagi on April 16

title: ED records Robert Vadra’s statement in 2008 Haryana land deal case
content: The case pertains to a 2008 land deal in Shikohpur of Gurugram, carried out by Skylight Hospitality, of which the husband of senior Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, who described the summons as ‘political vendetta’, was earlier a director

title: Fresh encounter breaks in J&K’s Poonch, forces launch operation
content: Additional troops have been inducted, and search operations are ongoing to prevent the terrorists from escaping, says Army

title: Pregnant woman delivers on train
content: The mother and baby were handed over to the Railway Protection Force (RPF) for further medical care and transport

title: Woman strangled to death in Wayanad
content: Husband accused of the murder admitted to Kozhikode Medical College Hospital with deep cuts on his wrist

title: A.P. Minister warns of strict action against rice millers for troubling farmers
content: The government is ensuring that paddy farmers receive the price of their produce within 24 hours of procurement, says Manohar

title: People have right to protest, not to take law into their hands: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
content: Mamata Banerjee said that some people not only criticise her because she visits programmes of various religions, but also change her surname

title: Isolated rains and thunderstorms may continue in A.P. until April 20
content: Mylavaram and Sunkesula in Kadapa district, Kalumala Doddi and Katikapalli in Chittoor, Boyalakuntla in Nandyal district received rain between 10 mm and 30 mm on Monday

title: A.P. cracks the whip on illicit liquor trade along inter-State borders
content: The ‘Navodayam 2.0’ initiative has resulted in seizures, destruction of illegal liquor, and dismantling of brewing units along the borders with Odisha, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, and Karnataka

title: CM Naidu, Lokesh pay rich tributes to Dr. Ambedkar
content: In a post on social media platform X, Mr. Naidu said that one must take inspiration from Dr. Ambedkar’s life.

title: After Shinde, Fadnavis now encroaching on Ajit Pawar’s ministry: Rohit Pawar
content: Praveen Pardeshi was recently appointed as Chief Economic Advisor whose job functions will include preparing reports on State finances, collaborating with NITI Aayog, and pushing initiatives for green energy

title: National Herald case: ED files chargesheet against Rahul, Sonia Gandhi
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a chargesheet against Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi concerning the National Herald case. This action follows the ED's recent initiation of proceedings to seize properties valued at over Rs 700 crore belonging to the Associated Journals Limited (AJL), a company with ties to both leaders.

title: India leads global recovery, first globally to erase Trump tariff losses
content: Indian stock markets rebounded strongly after a long weekend. The NSE Nifty 50 index rose significantly in Mumbai. India has recovered losses from US tariffs. It is seen as a safe haven amid global market uncertainty. Strong domestic growth supports this. India may benefit from supply chain shifts away from China.

title: India, US to begin talks on trade agreement this week
content: India and the United States are commencing discussions this week for a Bilateral Trade Agreement, starting virtually before an in-person meeting in May. This follows Prime Minister Modi and President Trump's agreement to strengthen ties, aiming to finalize the trade deal by fall. Both nations seek to expand bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030.

title: Will Trump's funding freeze truly impact Harvard University?
content: The Trump administration's proposed federal funding freeze raises concerns about its impact on universities, especially elite institutions like Harvard. While many universities may struggle, Harvard’s substantial endowment and diverse revenue streams provide resilience against such disruptions. With federal funding accounting for a small percentage of its overall revenue, Harvard is well-equipped to handle a freeze. Legal challenges are delaying the freeze’s implementation, but Harvard's financial strength ensures its research and operations remain stable despite external funding uncertainties.

title: TCS sees ‘Tata Motors-Sanand moment’ as it gets 21.16 acre land for 99 paisa
content: Andhra Pradesh's cabinet has approved allotting 21.16 acres of land to TCS in Visakhapatnam for a nominal price, aiming to transform the city into a major IT hub. TCS is expected to begin operations within 90 days, with a permanent campus housing 10,000 employees planned within 2-3 years.

title: 'Not a crime to be out of form, but ...': Ex-cricketer on Rohit Sharma
content: Rohit Sharma's underwhelming performance at the start of IPL 2025 is impacting the Mumbai Indians' campaign, according to Anjum Chopra. With MI struggling and Rohit's low scores leading to an "Impact Player" role, Chopra suggests a change in batting order might alleviate pressure and reignite his form, despite acknowledging his proven match-winning capabilities.

title: 'Neither optimistic nor pessimistic': Khamenei on nuclear talks with US
content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei expressed cautious optimism regarding nuclear talks with the US, acknowledging effective initial stages while maintaining skepticism. He advised against over-reliance on the talks' outcome. Despite Trump's frustration over slow progress and warnings of potential airstrikes, Iran insists the next round will occur in Oman, amidst escalating nuclear program concerns.

title: 'Wicket dekha, maar diya': Dhoni on his 'no-look' run-out. Watch
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Lucknow Super Giants in a recent IPL match. After the match, Rishabh Pant and MS Dhoni engaged in a lighthearted conversation. Dhoni discussed his spectacular run out of Abdul Samad. Zaheer Khan was also seen mimicking Dhoni's underarm action. Pant jokingly expressed his fear of being run out by Dhoni.

title: TikTok in US brings 'alive' the 'Chinese nightmare' of Birkin
content: Chinese factories are leveraging TikTok to sell directly to American consumers, bypassing retail markups and tariffs on luxury goods. Viral videos showcase alleged factory-direct alternatives to brands like Lululemon and Louis Vuitton, sparking debate about authenticity and pricing. While luxury brands deny Chinese manufacturing, experts warn of counterfeit operations capitalizing on tariff confusion to flood Western markets with fake goods.

title: CM Himanta declares Assamese compulsory official language for govt works
content: Assam has mandated Assamese as the compulsory official language for all government communications, including notifications and orders, as announced by chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. Bengali and Bodo will be used in the BTR and Barak Valley districts, respectively. English will remain for communication with the central government, but in case of interpretation differences, the English version will prevail.

title: India's retail inflation logs 3.34% in March 2025, nearly 6-year low
content: India's retail inflation hit a near six-year low of 3.34% in March, fueled by cheaper vegetables and protein-rich foods. This drop follows a recent repo rate cut by the RBI, which forecasts a 4% average CPI inflation for fiscal year 2025-26. Wholesale price inflation also decreased to a six-month low of 2.05%, driven by lower vegetable and essential food prices.

title: Sensex, Nifty surge over 2%: 5 reasons behind market rally
content: Indian stock markets saw a big jump. This happened after US President Trump paused some tariffs. The Sensex and Nifty both rose significantly. Investors feel more confident because of this change. India is also seen as a safe place to invest. Some sectors like auto and banking did well. People are watching to see what Trump does next with tariffs.

title: When Steve Jobs explained to Barack Obama why iPhones can’t be made in US
content: Donald Trump's push to revitalize American manufacturing through tariffs faces challenges, particularly for tech giants like Apple heavily reliant on Chinese production. Despite some supply chain diversification, Apple's iPhone manufacturing remains largely in China due to scale, speed, and specialized skills. While Trump aims to bring iPhone production to the US, past discussions reveal significant obstacles related to these factors.

title: China orders halt to Boeing jet deliveries as trade war with US intensifies
content: Amid trade tensions with the US, China has reportedly instructed its airlines to halt further Boeing aircraft deliveries and U.S. parts purchases following retaliatory tariffs. This move puts Boeing in a precarious position within a crucial market, where China is projected to represent 20% of global aircraft demand.

title: 'One has to be careful': SC on HC's rape victim ‘invited trouble’ remark
content: The Supreme Court has cautioned judges against making inappropriate remarks in sexual violence cases, specifically addressing comments made by the Allahabad High Court that blamed a woman for inviting the alleged rape. This follows the Supreme Court's intervention in another Allahabad High Court case where the court diminished the severity of sexual assault against a child.

title: Fast and furious: Woman slaps toll worker 7 times in 4 seconds
content: A woman was caught on CCTV assaulting a toll booth operator at the Chhijarsi Toll Plaza in Hapur after her FASTag showed insufficient balance. The woman slapped and attempted to strangle the attendant, while two men accompanying her misbehaved with staff. Police have registered a case and are working to locate the woman involved in the incident.

title: IPL today, PBKS vs KKR: Team prediction, pitch report and other details
content: Punjab Kings, reeling from a high-scoring defeat and struggling with bowling woes, face a confident Kolkata Knight Riders in Mullanpur. Key concerns for PBKS include their leaky bowling attack, reliance on underperforming overseas players, and sloppy fielding. KKR, boosted by a recent victory, will look to exploit Punjab's weaknesses with their strong batting lineup and versatile spin options.

title: Yogi announces State anti-poverty scheme to be named after Ambedkar
content: Akhilesh resolves to establish ‘reign of social justice’ on Ambedkar’s anniversary; Mayawati says ‘bad days’ are on for Dalits

title: Pushkar Singh Dhami felicitated by Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Mahamanch for implementing UCC
content: Dhami says Ambedkar believed true equality in society was not possible until every citizen of the country was granted equal rights

title: Meghalaya bags two top awards for work on Aadhaar
content: The recognition from the UIDAI came a day after anti-Aadhaar protestors hit the streets of the State’s capital Shillong

title: Amid ‘GPS spoofing’ claims, IAF says Myanmar ‘missions were achieved’ as planned
content: Global Positioning System spoofing is considered to be a form of cyberattack that includes generating false GPS signals to mislead an aircraft

title: Karnataka caste census report: Removal of exemption of ‘creamy layer’ concept for most backward classes termed ‘unfair’
content: Category 1-A has 46 castes/ sub castes from nomadic and semi nomadic castes identified by Karnataka in 1966

title: Jon Lee Anderson’s biography of Che Guevara released in Tamil
content: The two-volume translation captures the evolution of the greatest revolutionary and Marxist of the 20th Century and introduces him as a man with vulnerable moments, fears, and shortcomings

title: DMK government will always strive to ensure a bright future for Adi Dravidars and Tribal communities: Stalin
content: Speaking at an event held to commemorate Ambedkar’s birth anniversary, he says democracy has taken root across all domains through the transformation achieved by the Dravidian movement

title: Blast in firecracker unit: police, firemen, and local residents play pivotal role in rescue operation
content: Swift action in securing the large stock of firecrackers and raw materials stored on the premises prevented the fire from spreading further

title: Tamil Nadu police issue notice to IndiaMart portal for facilitating illegal sale of scheduled drugs
content: The police took the action following the arrest of at least 10 youth who had procured scheduled drugs illegally through the portal and seizure of more than 10,000 tablets at Sriperumbudur and Oragadam in Kancheepuram district recently

title: On Ambedkar Jayanti, Tejashwi visits house of Dalit man, terms BJP a ‘feudal party’
content: He also alleged that the BJP was continuously trying to weaken the ideology and Constitution of Baba Saheb

title: On Ambedkar Jayanti, a 40-year-old cry for justice
content: After their lands in Navi Mumbai were acquired for a port township project over 40 years ago, the residents have been living in a transit camp; their fight for rehabilitation has been continuing and they have now sought a CID probe into the reasons for the delay in their rehabilitation

title: Why Harvard's $53.2 billion endowment may not save it from Trump
content: Harvard University is in conflict with the Trump administration, which froze $2.2 billion in federal grants due to ideological disagreements. Harvard refuses to comply with demands to alter admissions policies and eliminate DEI programs, citing academic freedom. While facing financial strain and legal challenges, Harvard is standing firm against what it views as governmental overreach.

title: Taylor Swift opened up about the emotional damage from Kanye West and Kim Kardashian feud in 2023
content: Taylor Swift and Kanye West's feud reignites as West makes explicit posts about Swift, including disturbing sexual remarks. This comes after Swift revealed the trauma caused by West and Kim Kardashian's edited phone call release in 2016, which she says damaged her career. Travis Kelce is reportedly upset and wants to confront West, while Swift's fans have defended her online.

title: Court defers order on ED petition in MUDA case against Siddaramaiah
content: A Bengaluru Special Court has deferred its order on the ED's petition challenging the Lokayukta police's clean chit to CM Siddaramaiah in the MUDA site allotment case. The court awaits the Lokayukta's final report before ruling on the ED's challenge, which alleges the police overlooked key evidence.

title: 'Hope to negotiate good bilateral trade with US': India amid tariff tensions
content: India aims for a beneficial bilateral trade agreement with the United States, following the finalization of terms for the initial phase. Both nations seek to elevate bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030, targeting completion of the first phase by year-end. Trade liberalization will address both tariff and non-tariff barriers.

title: Vipraj Nigam, the accidental spinner who's turning heads in IPL
content: Vipraj Nigam's journey from an 8-year-old with a dream to an IPL sensation is a testament to unwavering family support and serendipitous talent discovery. His father, Vijay, despite a challenging government job posting, fueled his son's cricketing aspirations, while his mother and grandfather made daily sacrifices, traveling long distances to support his training. Now, his wickets of cricket giants like Kohli and Rohit in the IPL highlight a remarkable rise, proving that dedication and unexpected turns can shape an extraordinary career.

title: Baloch rebels used US weapons to hijack Pakistan's Jaffar Express: Report
content: Bloach rebels hijacked Pakistan's Jaffar Express last month. They used US weapons. These weapons were left in Afghanistan in 2021. The BLA attacked the train in Balochistan. The train was traveling to Peshawar. Security forces launched a rescue operation. Twenty-one passengers died in the attack. The terrorists contacted supporters in Afghanistan. Separatists want a greater share of Balochistan's resources.

title: MS Dhoni limping after CSK win - viral footage raises alarm bells
content: Following Chennai Super Kings' much-needed victory against Lucknow Super Giants, concerns arose as MS Dhoni was seen limping, sparking worries about his fitness. This adds to CSK's challenges, already struggling at the bottom of the IPL 2025 table. Dhoni, who recently resumed captaincy, also emphasized the need for improved pitches at Chepauk to boost the batters' confidence.

title: 'Poisonous campaign': Telangana CM Reddy snubs 'forest razing' charge
content: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy addressed the "forest encroachment" controversy, accusing the opposition of spreading propaganda using AI regarding the HCU land allegations. PM Modi criticized the Congress government for attempting to "bulldoze forests," prompting a strong rebuttal from the Congress, highlighting Modi's own record on environmental clearances and tree felling.

title: 'Cracks' on Rs 3,831 crore JP Ganga Path in Bihar sparks concern; officials respond
content: Following public concern over alleged cracks on Patna's newly inaugurated JP Ganga Path, Bihar officials clarified that the observed gaps are expansion joints designed for weather-induced movements, not structural flaws. Minister Nitin Nabin assured the public that the bridge is safe, with no structural cracks present, and the joints were refilled after filler material dislodged due to traffic.

title: India to experience above-normal rainfall this monsoon, says IMD
content: The India Meteorological Department forecasts above-normal rainfall for India during the June-to-September monsoon season, estimating 105% of the long-period average. El Nino conditions, typically linked to reduced rainfall, are not expected. This prediction is vital for India's agriculture, which supports a significant portion of the population and contributes substantially to the GDP.

title: Trump dismisses Xi Jinping’s Vietnam tour as effort to ‘screw’ US
content: Donald Trump accused China and Vietnam of conspiring to undermine the United States following Xi Jinping's visit to Hanoi, where he met with Vietnamese President To Lam and signed 45 cooperation agreements. Trump claimed President Biden had lost trillions in trade to China but expressed a continued liking for Xi.

title: 'Laaton ke bhoot': Yogi lambasts Mamata over Murshidabad violence
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath criticized West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for her alleged inaction regarding the Murshidabad violence, accusing her of enabling rioters under the guise of secularism. He also attacked Congress and Samajwadi Party for their silence on the issue, deeming them a burden on India.

title: Murshidabad violence: Initial probe flags role of suspected Bangladeshi miscreants
content: Following the recent violence in Murshidabad, West Bengal, initial probes suggest possible involvement of Bangladeshi miscreants. The MHA is coordinating with state authorities to maintain peace and considering enhanced border security. Over 200 arrests have been made and 11 FIRs registered after demonstrations against the waqf law led to three deaths.

title: Why diabetics should strictly avoid coconut water in summer
content: Bengalureans battling summer heat, face unique hydration challenges, especially diabetics. Dr. Ramalakshmi emphasizes that dehydration in diabetics can trigger electrolyte imbalances and kidney issues. She advises two to three liters of water daily, along with buttermilk and controlled portions of watermelon. Avoid fruit juices and jaggery drinks, opting for fenugreek water and ragi malt to prevent fatigue and kidney injury.

title: SC quashes Allahabad HC bail order in child trafficking case, slams UP govt
content: The Supreme Court has overturned the Allahabad High Court's bail order for three individuals accused of child trafficking, criticizing both the court and the Uttar Pradesh government for negligence. The court highlighted the need for parental vigilance and directed state governments and high courts to expedite child trafficking case trials.

title: MS Dhoni's chat with Sanjiv Goenka sets social media on fire
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Lucknow Super Giants by five wickets. CSK's bowlers set the stage, restricting LSG to 166/7, while Dhoni and Dube's explosive batting sealed the victory. Dhoni's reunion with LSG owner Sanjiv Goenka added a nostalgic touch to the win. After the game, Dhoni was seen conversing with Goenka who once owned Rising Pune Super Giant franchise where Dhoni played for two seasons.

title: 'Jaat' box office collection: Sunny Deol and Randeep Hooda's film slows down
content: Sunny Deol and Randeep Hooda's 'Jaat', an action thriller directed by Gopichand Malineni, has experienced a box office dip after a promising start boosted by the Mahavir Jayanti holiday. The film has grossed Rs 48.25 crore in India as of Day 6, with Tuesday collections estimated at Rs 75 lakhs.

title: Obama reacts to Trump admin's move to freezes $2.3bn funding for Harvard
content: Barack Obama lauded Harvard University for resisting the Trump administration's attempt to control academic freedom through a $2.2 billion funding freeze. Harvard refused to comply with directives to dismantle DEI initiatives and alter admissions policies. While Columbia University yielded to similar demands, Harvard President Alan Garber asserted the university's independence and constitutional rights against government overreach.

title: Indian agencies approached Belgium for Mehul Choksi’s extradition in October 2024
content: The Enforcement Directorate has so far attached and seized assets worth ₹2,566 crore in connection with the investigation against the Punjab National Bank scam case “mastermind”

title: 'No school can harass parents, child over fees': Delhi CM issues stern warning
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has strongly condemned schools for allegedly harassing parents and students over fee hikes, warning of strict consequences for violations. Parents of DPS Dwarka students have accused the school of publicly shaming and isolating children whose families refused to pay increased fees. The aggrieved parents are demanding investigation report and transparency from the DPS Society.

title: Air India's Chennai-Delhi flight delayed due to 'technical snag', flyers fume
content: An Air India flight from Chennai to Delhi experienced a significant delay due to a technical issue, causing frustration among passengers. The travelers expressed their anger over the lack of clear communication from the airline regarding the departure time. This incident follows recent criticism from comedian Vir Das, raising further concerns about Air India's service standards.

title: Harvard's $2.2 billion funding frozen: What triggered Trump admin’s move?
content: The Trump administration froze over $2.3 billion in federal funding to Harvard University, citing non-compliance with demands to address antisemitism and ideological bias. Harvard rejected these demands, deeming them politically motivated and an infringement on academic freedom. This action is part of a broader campaign targeting elite universities, aiming to reshape higher education and combat perceived left-leaning ideologies.

title: Haryana land deal: Robert Vadra at ED office after summon, alleges 'vendetta'
content: The Enforcement Directorate has issued a second summons to Robert Vadra, husband of Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, for questioning in a money-laundering investigation related to the Shikhopur land deal in Haryana. Vadra's company, Skylight Hospitality, acquired land in Shikohpur village in 2008 and later entered into an agreement with DLF to sell the land for a significantly higher price.

title: Tejashwi meets Rahul and Kharge to discuss seat-sharing plan; ducks CM question
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav met with Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi to strategize for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections and finalize seat-sharing. Yadav emphasized Bihar's economic struggles under the current government and sidestepped questions about the chief ministerial face, asserting the focus is on defeating the NDA.

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin forms high-level panel on autonomy amid rising tensions with Centre
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has announced a high-level committee, led by retired Justice Kurian Joseph, to examine state autonomy amid concerns of the Union government encroaching on state powers. The committee will study the relationship between the Union and states, focusing on transferring subjects from the Concurrent List back to the State List and addressing issues like NEET.

title: New York City declares April 14 as Dr BR Ambedkar Day
content: New York City has officially declared April 14th as Dr. BR Ambedkar Day, recognizing his significant contributions to democracy, women's empowerment, and justice for marginalized communities. The announcement was made by Dilip Chauhan from the NYC Mayor's Office for International Affairs, with Union Minister Ramdas Athawale expressing gratitude for honoring Ambedkar's global legacy.

title: Who are the most fun teams to watch this season? Let's rank all 30
content: we're back for our second annual MLB Watchability Index to identify this season's must-see squads . the original formula was years in the making, but after further research, we've tweaked it just a bit . we'll grade each team in five categories plus the potential for up to five bonus points .

title: Explained: Why China Might Have An Upper Hand In Trade War With US
content: The United States and China-- two of the world's largest economies-- are locked in a dangerous trade stand-off that may have no winners.

title: Tamil Nadu Student Attacks Classmate With Machete In Fight Over Pencil
content: A Class 8 student from a matriculation higher secondary school at Palayamkottai in Tamil Nadu's Tirunelveli district sustained multiple injuries after he was allegedly attacked by a classmate with a machete on Tuesday

title: US Reciprocal Tariffs A Challenge And A Chance For India: Commerce Secretary
content: Commerce Secretary Sunil Barthwal on Tuesday said that reciprocal tariffs are both a challenge and an opportunity for India with the government negotiating a bilateral trade deal with the US.

title: Telangana To Give Rs 4 Lakh To Heatwave Victims' Families
content: Telangana Government on Tuesday issued orders to declare heatwave/sunstroke as a "State Specific Disaster" henceforth for the purpose of providing relief to the families of the victims.

title: "Is It Census Of Hatred?": HD Kumaraswamy On Caste-Based Survey Report
content: Criticising the caste census report tabled before the Karnataka Cabinet, Union Minister H D Kumaraswamy on Tuesday questioned whether it was a caste census or a census of hatred.

title: "Appropriate Time Has Come": Omar Abdullah On Statehood For J&K
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Tuesday said he was hopeful that statehood will be restored to Jammu and Kashmir very soon and the "appropriate time has come".

title: 'Phule' Captures Education vs Caste Battle, Why It Has Sparked Controversy
content: Over 150 years ago, Mahatma Jyotiba Phule and Savitribai Phule led a battle against casteism that paved the way for a more progressive Maharashtra. Now, a film made about their lives has run into trouble.

title: Pune Man Facing Nearly 30 Criminal Cases Paraded By Police
content: Police paraded a man in handcuffs in the Pune locality where he resides and urged local residents to come forward and file complaints without any fear against him in case they have been troubled by him or his associates.

title: Retail Inflation Falls To 3.34% In March, Lowest Since August 2019
content: Retail inflation dipped marginally to a nearly six-year low of 3.34 per cent in March due to a decline in prices of vegetables and protein-rich items.

title: Karnataka Court's Big Order In MUDA Site Allotment Case Involving Siddaramaiah
content: A special court in Bengaluru has deferred its decision on the Enforcement Directorate's petition challenging the "B report" of Lokayukta in the MUDA land case, in which Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has been named.

title: Man Poisons, Kills Friend Due To Jealousy Over Wealth In Nagpur: Cops
content: A man has been arrested for allegedly poisoning and killing his 18-year-old friend and neighbour in Maharashtra's Nagpur city out of jealousy over his wealthy background, police said on Tuesday.

title: Journalist Recalls Night Mario Vargas Llosa Punched Gabriel Garcia Marquez
content: When journalist and novelist Elena Poniatowska headed to a film premiere in Mexico City, she had no idea she was about to witness the literary feud of the century as two future Nobel laureates came to blows.

title: Indian Markets First In World To Erase Losses Triggered By Trump Tariffs
content: The Indian stock market has become the first in the world to successfully erase all the losses triggered by Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff announcement.

title: Tejashwi Yadav Meets Mallikarjun Kharge, Rahul Gandhi To Discuss Bihar Polls
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav met senior Congress leaders, including party president Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi, here on Tuesday to discuss the Mahagathbandhan's preparedness for the upcoming Bihar assembly polls.

title: Couple Poisons, Slits Throats Of 3 Children, Then Tries To Die By Suicide
content: In a gruesome incident, a couple poisoned, strangled and slit the wrists and throats of their three children before attempting to end their own lives in a village here, police said on Tuesday.

title: This 100-Year-Old Woman Can Hold A Plank Longer Than Most Athletes
content: A New York woman celebrated her 100th birthday with something that not even people younger than her can perform - taking a five-minute plank test.

title: "Laaton Ke Bhoot...": Yogi Adityanath On Bengal Violence During Waqf Protest
content: Attacking the Mamata Banerjee government over the violence in Murshidabad during protests against the Waqf Amendment Act, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has said "Bengal is burning" and its Chief Minister is "silent"

title: US-China Trade War Escalates, Beijing Suspends Boeing Jet Deliveries
content: China has told its airlines to stop taking deliveries of jets from American aviation giant Boeing, a report said Tuesday, as a trade war between Beijing and the United States deepens.

title: DMK vs Tamil Nadu Governor Again, This Time Over Crimes Against Dalits
content: Less than a week after the Supreme Court pulled him up for blocking Bills, Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has targeted the MK Stalin-led DMK government over atrocities against Dalits

title: 'It's the best day of my golfing life': Rory McIlroy finally gets his green jacket
content: Rory McIlroy ends his long wait for a fifth major title and completes a career grand slam with a dramatic playoff victory over Justin Rose . he had walked up the final fairway not once but twice and fending off multiple players and overcoming his mistakes during an emotional 19 holes of golf . on Sunday, with the pressure of an 11-year major drought on his shoulders, Augusta's roars were prepared to serenade him during his breakthrough .

title: NWSL: Banda's Pride No. 1, winless Utah sink
content: barbra Banda beats barbra 1-0 at home to make it 1-0 . barbra are still the team to beat after defeating reign 1-0 on saturday . kate moss' side are outshot 13 to 7 and 5 to 4 on target .

title: Betting the 2025 NBA playoffs: Futures bets to make, best long shots
content: the 2024-25 playoffs begin Tuesday with the play-in tournament . the first round starts on Saturday, with the winners of each best-of-seven series advancing to the conference semifinals . what teams stand out as potentially undervalued and overlooked? here are betting experts andre Snellings, Eric Moody, Eric Karabell and Steve Alexander .

title: India To Witness Above-Normal Rainfall This Monsoon, Says Weather Office
content: the forecast is good news for agriculture and the economy as the sector accounts for 18% of India's gross domestic product (GDP) the livelihoods of over 42 per cent of the population also depend on agriculture . the system is critical for the supply of drinking water as well as power generation .
